Dialogue.Page: Hello, do you require something of me?

DialogueOption.Text: Yes! I'd love to know your secret phrase!

Dialogue.Page: You'll make a fine neutral third party, actually. You aren't even Nomai!
However, I can't remember what I set my code as, and I don't have the time to go through my notes, as we're nearing the Half-Hour mark!
I have to triple check everything, as something going wrong would be a catastrophe!
I did tell Citrine, though, so you should be able to get it from them.

DialogueOption.Text: Ok, I'll go talk to them!

Dialogue.Page: Every hour, on the hour, this star undergoes a curious transformation.
It shrinks down in size, yet retains the same energy!
An hour later, however, it balloons back to it's original size! Curious, no?
I believe it was Moisannite who discovered this, and shared it with the rest of our clan.
Our experiment is to see if we can artifically induce this transformation, and we picked the half-hour mark to avoid any interference from the star's natural transformation.
Once we can do this at will, we can attempt to replicate it under more controlled circumstances, and then we can revolutionize storage and transport!

DialogueOption.Text: Interesting, anyways, I'm going to go talk to Citrine now.
How are you powering this? I don't see any solar panels.

Dialogue.Page: We actually need very little power, according to our calculations.
There's actually a cell with around one hundred times that inside the star, so that we can attempt this multiple times if needed.

DialogueOption.Text: Interesting, anyways, I'm going to go talk to Citrine now.

Dialogue.Page: I'll get back to checking this, then.
